body_html: I think that being slower is somehow intended, since you have more parameters to optimize and more calculation to perform. The fact that it converges faster is intended as well. At that point, you could lower you learning rate to avoid the loss in accuracy (always, just on top of my head).
body_text: I think that being slower is somehow intended, since you have more parameters to optimize and more calculation to perform. The fact that it converges faster is intended as well. At that point, you could lower you learning rate to avoid the loss in accuracy (always, just on top of my head).
body: I think that being slower is somehow intended, since you have more parameters to optimize and more calculation to perform. The fact that it converges faster is intended as well. At that point, you could lower you learning rate to avoid the loss in accuracy (always, just on top of my head).
